snippet: The focus of efforts to address the diminishing African-American presence in baseball should not be on players alone.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column asserts that Major League Baseball needs a healthy pool of black players who can be a prime source for front-office positions throughout the sport; says that Jackie Robinson knew better than most that power and control are the requisites for any group to succeed in baseball and in life.
lead_paragraph: The focus of efforts to address the diminishing African-American presence in baseball should not be on players alone.

headline.seo: Real Jackie Robinson Tribute Would Be More Blacks in Management
headline.main: More Blacks in Management Would Be a True Robinson Tribute
headline.print_headline: More Blacks in Management Would Be a True Robinson Tribute
